fixed_template.introduction: {{The aim of this report is to}} [assess/evaluate/examine] [topic]. {{The relevant information was obtained}} [through/by/from] [method: surveys/questionnaires/interviews/observations].
fixed_template.neutral: {{It was generally felt that}} [neutral assessment: adequate/acceptable/satisfactory]. {{This was mainly due to}} [reason/cause].
fixed_template.praising: {{By far the best aspect of}} [topic] {{is}} [strength/positive feature]. {{Considering that}} [context], {{this}} [benefit/impact: proved invaluable/exceeded expectations/was particularly valuable].
fixed_template.recommending: {{In order to}} [improve/address/enhance] [aspect], {{it is essential that}} [action]. {{If this change is made, it would}} [positive outcome/benefit].
fixed_template.conclusion: {{On the whole, it was felt that}} [summary statement]. [Key priority/recommendation]. [Final forward-looking statement].

methods: The relevant information was obtained through surveys of students.

assessment: resources were sufficient for current needs
reason: This was mainly due to recent improvements.
The facilities have been maintained regularly.
Staff have worked hard to ensure quality.

subject: the quality of equipment
the helpful attitude of staff
the variety of resources available
the accessibility of facilities
the modern technology provided
the cleanliness and organization
elaboration: This has greatly enhanced the learning experience.

This exceeds expectations and sets a high standard.
This demonstrates a real commitment to quality.

opening: However, a common complaint related to
impact: This affects students' ability to complete their work effectively.
As a result, many students feel unable to make full use of the facilities.
This has led to considerable frustration among users.

This creates unnecessary stress for students.

opening: In order to address this issue, it is essential that
A practical solution would be to
The most effective approach would be to
action: the school extends the opening hours
more space is allocated to the facility

Addressing the space issue should be the top priority.
Updating equipment must be considered urgent.
Investment in resources would make the biggest difference.
The key recommendation is to improve accessibility.

final: With these changes, the facility would better serve the school community.
Such improvements would ensure students have the resources they need.
These recommendations would create a much more effective learning environment.

fixed_template.introduction: {{The aim of this report is to}} assess [community facility/service/issue]. {{Information was obtained by}} attending [meetings/consultations] {{and interviewing}} [local residents/stakeholders].
fixed_template.neutral: {{It was generally felt that}} [topic] {{could bring some}} [benefits/improvements]. {{This was mainly due to}} [reason: potential/opportunities/planning].

aims: The aim of this report is to assess
The purpose of this report is to evaluate
This report provides an analysis of
The objective of this report is to review
topics: traffic management in the town center
methods: Information was obtained through community consultation meetings.
Data was gathered from resident surveys and interviews.
Research was conducted via public forums and feedback sessions.
Evidence comes from both official reports and resident input.
Findings are based on town hall meetings and written submissions.
Information was collected through a combination of surveys and site visits.

opening: On balance, the community view is that
assessment: the proposal has both merits and drawbacks
the plan addresses some community needs
the project has some positive aspects
certain elements of the plan are welcome
reason: This was mainly due to the potential for job creation.
The area has been in need of investment.
The proposal responds to some long-standing issues.

opening: By far the best aspect is
A definite strength of the proposal is
subject: the improved accessibility for disabled residents
the commitment to environmental sustainability
the creation of new employment opportunities
the enhancement of community facilities
the consultation process with local people
the quality of design and planning
elaboration: This addresses long-standing concerns in the community.
Many residents have been calling for this for years.
This represents a significant step forward.
The benefits to the local area would be substantial.
This demonstrates genuine responsiveness to community needs.
Such provision would greatly enhance quality of life.

opening: Many people expressed serious worries about
The main source of opposition is
problem: increased traffic would cause severe congestion
noise pollution would affect quality of life
green space would be lost permanently
impact: This would seriously affect residents' daily lives.
The environmental consequences could be devastating.
Local businesses fear they would be driven out.
The area's unique character would be lost forever.

opening: In order to address these concerns, it is essential that
A more acceptable approach would be to
action: a full environmental impact assessment is conducted
traffic management plans are developed first
the scale of development is reduced
genuine consultation with residents takes place
benefit: This would address the main community concerns.
This would demonstrate respect for residents' views.
The proposal would then be much more acceptable.
This would protect what makes the area special.
Community support would be far more likely.

summary: On the whole, while the proposal has merits
To sum up, the concerns outweigh the benefits
In conclusion, significant modifications are needed
Overall, the proposal in its current form is unacceptable
priority: Environmental protection must be the top priority.
Traffic concerns must be addressed before proceeding.
Community consultation should be genuine and meaningful.
Alternative sites must be seriously considered.
The scale must be reduced to preserve local character.
Residents' quality of life should take precedence.
final: With these changes, the proposal could benefit the whole community.
Without such modifications, the plan should be rejected.
Only through proper consultation can an acceptable solution be found.
The future of our community depends on getting this right.
By listening to residents, a better outcome is possible.
These recommendations would ensure development serves community interests.
